purpleculture_pinyin:
gān
embarrassed; ill at ease
смущенный; не по себе
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 尴)
Pictophonetic: 監 indicates the sound; 尢 (lame) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples: 尷尬 [ gān gà ]: awkward; embarrassed
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿺ Surround from lower left
    • 尢 [ yóu ] weak, lame
    • 監 [ jiān ] to supervise, to direct, to control; to inspect; prison, jail
heisig_chinese_memo: Whenever my frankenbowser gets caught on hidden camera he becomes abashed and sticks his tail between his legs.
Ru_trainchinese: gān: (прил) затруднительное (неловкое) положение; (диал.) оказаться в неловком положении
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Whenever my frankenbowser gets caught on hidden camera he becomes abashed and sticks his tail between his legs.
humanum_full_description_en:
from " in particular ", " prison " sound. "Embarrassed" is a continuous word. The original work is "Awk", "Shuowen": "Ah, it is not correct." Duan Yucai changed to: "Aw, Awk, is not correct." Note: The word 尲尲 is now supplemented according to the general rules of the whole book. The line character is also added." Zhu Junsheng "Shuowen Tongxun Dingsheng": "The character is embarrassing."

"Embarrassed" describes a crooked and unhealthy walking posture, and by extension it means misbehavior and sneaky. Such as "Kingmoto Popular Novels. Xishan Yikugui": "This Chinese character for opening a hotel is embarrassing, and it's also a ghost!" Chapter 10 of "Water Margin": "But there is an embarrassing man from Tokyo. Please take care of the camp here and give it to me. Half-day wine."

"Embarrassed" later often means that the situation is difficult or the matter is difficult, which makes people embarrassed. Such as Wang Bocheng in Yuan Dynasty "Shaobian. "Gift to the Bachelor of Changchun Palace Xue'an" composer: "I won the hardship of this body, the furniture is extraordinarily awkward." The 23rd "Journey to the West": "Since you do housework, you can discuss it with your master. Don't be embarrassed, just call you."

"Embarrassed" is also used as "not embarrassed" or "not embarrassed or embarrassed". " No " is an auxiliary word and does not mean. For example, Volume 17 of "The First Moment, A Surprise," Volume 17: "Here Zhiguan is waiting to enter the house, and only hears the sound of the door of the house, knowing not embarrassment, shocked, and not having time to speak, turn around and leave." "Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 90: "(Xue Tao) and seeing Bao Chan such a sneaky, not embarrassing situation, I also felt a little bit." See " Awkward ."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " in particular ", " prison " sound. "Embarrassed" is a continuous word that describes a crooked walking posture.
humanum_full_description:
從「尢」，「監」聲。「尷尬」是連綿詞，本作「尲尬」，《說文》：「尲，不正也。」段玉裁改為：「尲，尲尬，行不正也。」注云：「各本奪尲尬二字，今依全書通例補。又補行字。」朱駿聲《說文通訓定聲》：「字俗作尷。」

　　「尷尬」形容行走姿勢歪邪不正，引申表示行為不端正、鬼鬼祟祟。如《京本通俗小說．西山一窟鬼》：「這個開酒店的漢字又尷尬，也是鬼了！」《水滸傳》第10回：「卻才有個東京來的尷尬人，在我這裏請管營、差撥吃了半日酒。」

　　「尷尬」後來多表示處境困難或事情棘手，使人困窘。如元代王伯成《哨遍．贈長春宮雪庵學士》套曲：「謾贏得此身良苦，家私分外，活計尷尬。」《西遊記》第23回：「既然幹得家事，你再去與你師父商量商量看，不尷尬，便招你罷。」

　　「尷尬」又作「不尷尬」或「不尷不尬」，「不」是助詞，不表義。如《初刻拍案驚奇》卷17：「這裡知觀正待進房，只聽得本家門首鑼響，曉得不尷尬，驚得魂不附體，也不及開一句口，掇轉身往外就走。」《紅樓夢》第90回：「（薛蝌）及見了寶蟾這種鬼鬼祟祟，不尷不尬的光景，也覺了幾分。」參見「尬」。
humanum_short_description: 從「尢」，「監」聲。「尷尬」是連綿詞，形容行走姿勢歪邪不正。

Pinyin: gān
English Definition: embarrassed; ill at ease
Total strokes: 17; Radical: 尢
Pictophonetic: 監 indicates the sound; 尢 (lame) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿺ Surround from lower left
    • 尢 [ yóu ] weak, lame
    • 監 [ jiān ] to supervise, to direct, to control; to inspect; prison, jail
Example Words:

More: 尷* | *尷 | *尷*

尷字的基本解释

尷
gān
见“尴”。

尷字的汉语字典释义

[①]［gān］
同“尲1”。亦作“1”。“尴1”的繁体字。亦作“魐1”。
